messages: 231085505aac96c098c8583bd29511b2 (11:57): can you jumpstsart solaris2.6?
5f6c99cfe1304895e02c609c9fed9cb1 (12:00): ofu_: upgrade, upgrade, upgrade. 2.6 is so last century
2b9d13217ca1d39934ebc86a4be0924f (12:01): officially dead, yay
fd686aa46da1e08426b09b3eaf579ed2 (12:02): now to contend with all the Sol 7 installs
231085505aac96c098c8583bd29511b2 (12:02): i know 2.6 is old and dead and i do not want to use it
231085505aac96c098c8583bd29511b2 (12:03): but we just had an arguement if this version could be jumpstarted
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:03): does vold crash often?
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:03): or iiimd? :)
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:05): Yes, you could jumpstart 2.6
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:07): boyd: that was kinda what i thought about when i read about WIS
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:07): specifically the fact that if 2 files were the same it didn't waste space on them
5f6c99cfe1304895e02c609c9fed9cb1 (12:07): ofu_: docs.sun.com Solaris 2.4 has jumpstart

d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:08): I like the idea that an install could put some stuff (optional sw)? in a separate zfs that could be easily deleted. So most of install would be a big zfs recv
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:09): if there's no cost for zfs partitions
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:09): it'd be nice if each package that didn't bother root was its own zfs partition
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (12:10): sounds like people would bitch even more over the PATH issue... if everything was its own filesystem.. path would be 500 times worse than today.

c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:10): although, i suppose that would /kinda/ influence your ability to properly snapshot a system. although on the other hand, your snapshot would say which version of a package you installed which should be good enough
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:10): jamesd: eh?
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:10): snapshot -r fixes that
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (12:11): boyd: heh, ok, scratch my only concern from the list :)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (12:11): PATH=/path/to/package1:/path/to/package2/:.... till package 1000,:/usr/bin/:/usr/local/bin:/opt/csw/bin

fd686aa46da1e08426b09b3eaf579ed2 (12:16): amazon still doesn't have it available

9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:43): can anyone review the following (simple) ipfilter rules: http://pastebin.ca/99405 They can't allow me to filter all packets except ssh :(
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (13:43): try to add "keep state" at the end of your ssh rule
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:44): let me see :)
a28f992548f33450f6c9e7a784d81ea0 (13:44): get ipf-howto and read it. it's step-by-step guide
a28f992548f33450f6c9e7a784d81ea0 (13:44): google will help
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:45): yes, I have read it
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:45): still doesn't work with keep state :(
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (13:45): not enough carefully
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:46): any suggestion?
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:47): pass in quick on hme0 proto tcp from any to any port = 22 flags S keep state kee
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:47): p frags
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:47): that's why I use for ssh
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:47): s/why/what
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:49): lasseoe: doesn't work :'(((
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:50): is it necessary to reboot the machine after apply new rules or is enough by doing a ipf -Fa -f newrules?
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:50): that's sufficient
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:51): lasseoe: do you have a block default policy?
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:51): sgnut, try switching your ssh line and the last block in fjgi line
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:51): swap them around
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:56): lasseoe: do you mean to put the "block in on fjgi0 all" before the ssh rule?
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (13:56): yes
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:56): doesnt work :(
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (13:57): I have a "quick" parameter in the ssh rule, so... it should be applied first insted of the "block in on fjgi0 all"
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (14:00): sgnut, http://pastebin.ca/99418
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (14:00): that should work.
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (14:00): skip the loopback interface unless you want to filter on it
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (14:02): oh yes!!! the problema was in the keep state on the "out" rule!!!!
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (14:02): lasseoe: thanx a lot :D
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (14:03): I miss the keep state... so all the packets was filtered
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (14:03): :D :D
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (14:03): np
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (14:06): morning
9a81eda5ab8eb52f1da1ddb62e35e340 (14:16): Anyone knows if ipfilter supports mac adress filter?
